trans-unit.source: Represents a link to an external resource.
The <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> class is used to include references to files in an XML resource (.resx) file.
A <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> object represents a link to an external resource in an XML resource (.resx) file.

You add the <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> object to a .resx file by calling the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%28System.Resources.ResXDataNode%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
In a data entry in a .resx file, the type is <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef>, and the value is the path location on disk.
When the resource manager deserializes the object, the <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> performs the I/O to get the file.
The following is an example of a .resx file.

To add a <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> object to a .resx file programmatically, you call the <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Resources.ResXFileRef%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor to instantiate a <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object.
You then pass this <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object to the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

When you compile a .resx file with [Resgen.exe (Resource File Generator)](~/docs/framework/tools/resgen-exe-resource-file-generator.md), the resources specified in the .resx file are embedded in the resulting document resource file.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> class that references the specified file.
The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.
The file to reference.
The type of the resource that is referenced.
fileName or typeName is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> class that references the specified file.
The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.
The file to reference.
The type name of the resource that is referenced.
The encoding used in the referenced file.
Gets the file name specified in the current <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef.#ctor*"></xref> constructor.
The name of the referenced file.
Gets the encoding specified in the current <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef.#ctor*"></xref> constructor.
The encoding used in the referenced file.
Gets the text representation of the current <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> object.
A string that consists of the concatenated text representations of the parameters specified in the current <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef.#ctor*"></xref> constructor.
Gets the type name specified in the current <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef.#ctor*"></xref> constructor.
The type name of the resource that is referenced.
